intro: Teclea zenkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has fleshy, thick leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Teclea zenkeri typically grows as a small shrub or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually tubular or bell-shaped, with five petals that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
